question: You recently took a trip with a taxi company. The driver behaved in an unacceptable way and you had a lot of problems. You complained to the company but no-one has replied to your complaint. Write a letter to the taxi company. In your letter • say why you are writing and how you feel • explain what happened • tell them what you would like them to do.
text: I am writing this letter to express my dissatisfaction with the service that I received from one of your taxi drivers last month.
Although I have written an email to your customer service centre to narrate what your driver did when he drove me last month, I have not been contacted until now. I find this fairly unacceptable.

On 20th March, I went to Sydney to meet one of my important clients. After arriving at the Sydney airport, I took your company’s taxi and told the driver my destination clearly, which was the Sofia Hotel CBD branch. However, the drive took me to another Sofia hotel that is extremely far away from my destination, which made me miss my appointment and caused a significant economic detriment to me.

In my opinion, as this is definitely the driver’s fault, I require that the taxi fee  should be refunded to me immediately. In addition, I reckon I am entitled to compensation for the financial loss and an apology.
Please respond to my email at the earliest opportunity to discuss the solution to this problem. I am looking forward to your reply.
